view.desc:
Start a web based app to view and interact with project runs.

When the server is running, open your browser on the specified port (default is 6333) - e.g. http://localhost:6333.

To log server requests, use --logging.

To modify the refresh interval (default is 5 seconds), use --interval. This is useful for longer running operations that don't need to be refreshed often.

options.desc: print training details but do not train
set a project flag; may be used multiple times

train.desc:
Trains MODEL if specified, otherwise trains the default model.

The default model is the first model defined in the project config.

Models are trained by their configured 'train' operation, which must be specified.

If the specified model does not exist or cannot be trained because it does not define a train operation, the command exits with an error.

serve.desc:
Serve a trained model in RUNDIR or the latest using --latest-run.

Use 'guild list-runs' to list runs that can be used for RUNDIR.

options.desc: print training details but do not train
set a project flag; may be used multiple times

prepare.desc:
Prepares MODEL for training if specified, otherwise prepares the default model.

The default model is the first model defined in the project config.

Models are prepared by their configured 'prepare' operation, if specified. If the specified model doesn't define a prepare operation, the command exits with an error message.

list_series.desc:
List series for a run in RUNIDR or the latest using --latest-run.

Use 'guild list-runs' to list runs that can be used for RUNDIR.

options.desc: show only runs that were stopped by the user
show only runs that stopped due to an error
show only runs that were stopped by the user or due to an error
show only runs an exported model

list_attrs.desc:
List attributes for a run in RUNIDR or the latest using --latest-run.

Use 'guild list-runs' to list runs that can be used for RUNDIR.

options.desc: script used to train the model
print project file to stdout instead of creating a file

init.desc:
Initialize a Guild project.

By default Guild creates an annotated project file in DIR (defaults to current directory) or prints to standard output if --print is specified. Specify a template to create a specific project type. Guild provides preconfigured templates that can be referenced by name (see list below) or you may specify a full path to your own Guild template.

Available template names:

!!  annotated      fully annotated project
!!  tensorflow     use for typical TensorFlow project (default)

options.desc: print evaluate details but do not train
set a project flag; may be used multiple times

evaluate.desc:
Evaluate a trained model in RUNIDR or the latest using --latest-run.

Use 'guild list-runs' to list runs that can be used for RUNDIR.

The model applicable to the run must have an evaluate operation operation defined.

delete_run.desc:
Remove a run by deleting RUNDIR or the latest using --latest-run.

Use 'guild list-runs' to list runs that can be used for RUNDIR.
